Interface GlobalHelper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Boost, Camera, Dog, Elephant, Enemy, Item, Octopus, Oil, Panel, Player, Racer, RenderableObject, Tomato, World

    public interface GlobalHelper

    Global Constants Interface

    Holds useful methods and variables that are globally used by multiple classes.
    Since:
    2015-09-11
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd

    • Method Detail

      • getHypotenuse

        static double getHypotenuse(double a,
                            double b)
        Calculates the distance between two points using pythagoras.
        Parameters:
        a - The first point, potentially an x distance.
        b - The second point, potentially a y distance.
        Returns:
        Returns the "c" value, the hypotenuse that these two points create.

      • readTextDataFile

        static java.lang.String[] readTextDataFile(java.lang.String targetFile)
        This method returns the data section of a text file that is read in. Each index in the array of strings is a new line. The splitting of this string is left up to the method which processes the data in case each data file is slightly different in layout. In order to return a static array, it has to make two sweeps of file. The first counts how many items there are, therefore allowing us to make the right sized array, and the second then fills this array. While efficiency isn't of the utmost concern, I figure that file reading is fairly cheap so this solution allows us to avoid a dynamic array in exchange for an (albeit slightly) more efficient static array. Doesn't start reading the lines into the output array until the START_READING marker is encountered. Code credit for the BufferedReader snippet to: mkyong http://www.mkyong.com/java/how-to-read-file-from-java-bufferedreader- example/
        Parameters:
        targetFile - A string containing the file path of the text file to be read.
        Returns:
        output The array of Strings, one item for each line.
